entries.title: Advance Release Calendar of the BCRA publications schedule for 2017
entries.text: Daily Publications: The information is published daily within 24 business hours of the date to which the data refers to.

entries.title: Statistical Bulletin - BCRA
entries.text: Statistical Bulletin. This bulletin compiles and publishes statistical series of the main monetary and financial variables of Argentina.

entries.title: Statistical Bulletin, June 2025 - BCRA
entries.text: This is a monthly bulletin of statistical series on the main monetary and financial variables of Argentina. June 13, 2025.

entries.title: Private Sector External Debt Standardized Statistics - BCRA
entries.text: Standardized statistical series of private sector external debt positions from December 31, 2017 are displayed on a quarterly basis.

entries.title: Foreign Trade and Exchange Regulations - BCRA
entries.text: Such rules basically provide the following: Transactions must be made through an institution licensed to trade in the foreign exchange market.

entries.title: Regulations on Foreign Currency Availability for Foreign Investors
entries.text: The measures adopted by the BCRA have contributed to improving the conditions to access the forex market for the repatriation of direct investments.

entries.title: Monetary Policy Report - BCRA
entries.text: This quarterly publication analyzes the national and international economic context, assesses inflation dynamics and its outlook.

entries.title: Argentina's Inflation Targets Regime. Press Conference - BCRA
entries.text: Federieco Sturzenegger, Governor of the Central Bank of Argentina, has given a press conference to unveil Argentina's Inflation Targets Regime.

entries.title: Press Conference by Guido Sandleris - BCRA
entries.text: We have called you today to explain the economic measures announced yesterday. These measures seek to protect exchange rate stability and savers.

entries.title: BCRA Updates Monetary Policy Rate
entries.text: The Board has decided to raise the monetary policy rate by 300 basis points. This way, the APR on 28-day LELIQs has risen from 78% to 81%.
